{awang belum selamat} part1i have been following and reading arguments on the forest city real estate project in johor.the sultan of the state gave an interview to the star newspaper and slammed tun dr mahathir mohamad and threw a challenge at him.the sultan said, he welcomes foreign direct investment (fdi) and today china has many very rich people.he said johor is not giving away land and, furthermore, the land being developed is reclaimed land and, therefore,extends johor’s land area.forest city is open to buyers from all over the world including johor malays.singapore reclaims land too and does it in a very big way. but it hasn't got forest city. singapore must have a very good reason not to have a project like forest city.sultan also compared this “fdi” to singapore and said, johore should take singapore as a model. it welcomes and attracts rich people to buy its properties and this has notaffected its political stability.dr mahathir, therefore, is using the racial line to put fear in the people and the sultan is fed up of dr mahathir's line of argument.lf we want to follow singapore, we should follow how the people there handle the 1mdb scandal. two banks that channeled 1mdb’s money and the people involved were charged and convicted.to singapore, 1mdb is about crime. in malaysiagovernment and its supporters say it’s politics.the sultan said, he is above politics but dr m is critising government policies which are made by politicians.where is the menteri besar of johor or the prime minister of malaysia.federal constitution and state constitutions spell out that the rulers are above politics.dr mahathir replied to the challenge. he said he was quoting reports by the bloomberg news service.

{awang belum selamat} part 2why did the sultan slammed him and not bloomberg that wrote the story in the first place?then dr mahathir said, to be transparent why not publish the agreements so public would be able to make their own judgment?dr mahathir said, he was taking a risk as could be charged in court.after dr mahathir published his reply, it was reported that the sultan refuses to debate with him (dr mahathir) as he (the sultan) has said what he wanted to say.it must be noted this is not the first time the sultan had said things about dr mahathir.when dr mahathir replied the sultan’s personal attack on him, the rakyat expect the sultan to rebut and the best rebuttal is to make public the agreements.the sultan has said what he said was based on facts. the question is these facts can only be confirmed by publishing the agreements.earlier questions were asked if the environmental impact study has been done. the sultan was reported to have said that projects in johore benefit the state and did not see theneed for federal agencies getting involved.many support dr mahathir and believe his concern and worries are correct and genuine. he reminded us when, in the early days, the then sultan of johor refused to sign the treaty giving away singapore to the british, the british got the temenggong to sign it and johor lost singapore forever.there are those who criticised dr mahathir and said it makes no sense to say foreigners who buy properties in johor willbe given citizenship. the society of professors said this and this is the same society that has never faulted the government on any issue - not even1mdb.najib said dr mahathir slandered. lf najib really believes dr mahathir slandered, he should sue. i am sure dr mahathiris prepared to be sued.like dr mahathir, most malaysians would like to see the forest city agreement.

{awang belum selamat} part 3najib please sue dr mahathir and we see the evidence in court. if the role of professors are just to support government policies no wonder our graduates can't get jobs after graduation. the sultan said johor malays can buy these apartments but a few who visited site wrote that they can't afford as price is beyond them.we are told chinese developer has a project in china where if a chinese buyer buys one apartment in china, he will get one free in forest city.lf this is true, where is the fdi? if really there is fdi, it will reflect in bank negara's reserves. but bn has announced that its reserves have been falling.we also should be watching bn's reserves to see whether rm140-billion chinese investments, which najib announced during his recent visit to china is real or not.then we will know if these are genuine investments or contracts which we have to pay and not fdi as claimed bynajib.ministers say if foreigners buy properties here they can't take away the properties to their countries. only idiots argue like this. we should not waste time to reply to idiots.we welcome genuine fdis but we must maintain peace and political stability in malaysia. our history shows us political stability will attract fdis and allow growth with equity.just because the government has messed up the economy and country by creating 1mdb and to save the kleptocratic leader we must not allow them to sell national assets.malaysians must always remember what the temenggong of johor did.

{a kadir jasin} esteemed debaters and visitor,1. those of us who are malaysians and care about our country, have to make greater efforts to understand the "new china".2. it is hard to assume that neither najib nor zahid is unware of china’s expansionary policy.3. if they do not, i hope our defence experts and military leadership do because some of the things that najib and zahid are doing today could make us an easy target of china’s new defence doctrine.4. a chinese defense white paper released on 26 may 2015, among other things, outlined a new military strategy that emphasizes a more “active defense posture” and a greater chinese naval presence farther from china’s shores.5. it was the ninth such paper to be published since 1998, but the first to focus exclusively on strategy.6. the principal doctrine of the chinese military appears to be unaltered: winning local wars under conditions of informationization. thus, network-centric warfare and the growing informatization of the battlefield are seen as particularly important for the pla’s “preparation for military struggle (pms).”7. “the world revolution in military affairs (rma) is proceeding to a new stage. long-range, precise, smart, stealthy and unmanned weapons and equipment are becoming increasingly sophisticated. outer space and cyber space have become new commanding heights in strategic competition among all parties,” the paper notes.8. with the tensions in the north and south china over territorial claims, the doctrine places a premium on maritime combat readiness. it says:in line with the evolving form of war and national security situation, the basic point for pms will be placed on winning informationized local wars, highlighting maritime military struggle and maritime pms. 9. the paper speaks about china’s aspirations towards a blue-water navy and an increased chinese naval presence outside territorial waters:in line with the strategic requirement of offshore waters defense and open seas protection, the pla navy (plan) will gradually shift its focus from “offshore waters defense” to the combination of “offshore waters defense” with “open seas protection,” and build a combined, multi-functional and efficient marine combat force structure. the plan will enhance its capabilities for strategic deterrence and counterattack, maritime maneuvers, joint operations at sea, comprehensive defense and comprehensive support.10. unless we are stupid or have sold our souls to china we must not discount the likelihood of china using all possible means, including economic enslavement and espionage, to neutralise its neighbours.11. buying chinese military equipment and border surveillance equipment increases china’s foothold in our country. and having hundreds of thousands chinese visiting, studying, working and staying in malaysia makes its preparation for military struggle (pms) easier.wallahuaklam.

{zalman a} in october 2016 president of the mca, datuk seri liow tiong lai, said that the opposition's desire to ensure a straight fight against barisan nasional is just "empty talk". he was quoted as saying that members of the opposition coalition have big differences between each other and this will lead to them fighting each other.liow is exactly right. the opposition coalition has no clear leader today and their leaders send conflicting messages to the public. since the break up of pakatan rakyat, and despite the formation of the new pakatan harapan, they have not been able to come up with a coherent and unified policy platform. that may very well lead to multi-cornered fights, just as liow predicted.the weakest point for pakatan harapan is when they are asked to name their candidate for prime minister. the answers that they have given so far has been weak and unconvincing.one side of pakatan wants to have datuk seri anwar ibrahim as the prime minister. in their desperation to show loyalty to anwar, some pakatan leaders have suggested that once they win, they will get anwar to be pardoned by the agong so that he can contest and eventually become prime minister. for this to happen, they also suggest that datin seri wan azizah should be appointed as interim prime minister, warming up the seat until her husband is freed.there is another group who wants pakatan to move beyond anwar. they are not saying anwar should be forgotten. but they feel we cannot have a puppet interim prime minister. the premiership is not something that can be tossed around between husband and wife as thy wish. hence they insist that someone else should be named as pakatan's candidate for prime minister. several names have been proposed, including tan sri muhyiddin yassin.there is also another group who simply wants to avoid the issue altogether. they found it too difficult to give a straight answer, and, rather than working it out, they skirt the issue. as an excuse they claim that it is too early to think about who will become prime minister because, according to them, pakatan should focus on issues that are more important to the people.in short, pakatan is so divided and they can't even unite on one of the most fundamental questions that any rational voter would ask. surely pakatan leaders realise that the whole country is asking the question.

{zalman a} liow was obviously comparing pakatan to barisan nasional and that is where he went wrong. he thought barisan nasional is a "united" coalition. that is false. barisan nasional is not united as such. they are merely subservient.barisan nasional today has become a coalition of many irrelevant parties dictated by one supreme overlord. they are no longer equals. the big brother is free to entertain or ignore other minions as they wish.for example, when chinese schools were having difficulty to access their funding recently, liow was only able to say that he will "follow up" with the prime minister on this issue.worse, mca's senator chong sin woon who is also deputy minister of education was reported to say "mca insists that chinese primary schools should receive the full allocation."when a deputy minister can only "insist", and a full minister can only "follow up", you know how influential the party is.of course the mca may eventually get the money but the rule remains, namely, mca can beg but they must obey. if they disagree with a decision, all they can do is just "insist" and "follow up". the relationship in barisan nasional is more like a master and a servant, not a relationship between equals.i personally do not like the policies that was offered by the previous pakatan rakyat and i suspect many of the policies that will be offered by pakatan harapan will follow the same streak. but when it comes to the way the coalition is managed, i still prefer the division and disunity of pakatan.they are a coalition of equals, and when everyone is equal, unity is not easy to get because there is no big brother. no one party is more supreme than the other. if any component party has an idea or a suggestion, they must propose, persuade and win the public debate rather than bulldoze it through. that is a much more democratic and unauthoritarian way of making decisions.wan saiful, ideas

{zalman a}  hari ini, tidak lagi mampu membayar dividen seperti dahulu2 dalam belasan peratus. hari ini terpaksa jual asset satu demi satu untuk terus membayar dividen. jika tidak, mereka yang dahulu bersetuju memindahkan share kpf kepada fgv akan terdedah menjadi ejen dan barua isa samad dan najib razak. duit rm2.2 billion mungkin telah lesap. yang boleh ditunjukkan oleh kpf ialah ladang sawit di sarawak yang terpaksa ada kos nya. mengapa kpf tidak buka ladang ala felda disana jika sudah ada ladang besar?disini bising sangat hendak buka ladang untuk jenerasi ke2.ini  patut jadi bisnes model nya- kpf beli ladang besar dan buka estet ala felda. jika kpf membeli, maka tanah2 kerajaan yang percuma itu, boleh di mohon oleh anak2 bangsa yang bukan jenerasi ke2 atau ke3 felda.  kesian lah kepada anak kampong tradisional dan orang melayu yang miskin dalam bandar.sekarang nasi sudah jadi bubur. apabila kamu menyediakan tempat tidur, maka terpaksalah kamu yang tidur diatas nya. kpf sudah tidak ada dan wang mengurang. lama kelamaan kpf akan hilang semua.jika pengurusan kpf dilakukan oleh puak peneroka sendiri, ingat lah najib tidak memandang kamu sebagai ada potensi. itulah sebab nya kpf ditendang keluar dari fgv. dia tahu kpf akan jahanam. persepsi najib keatas kpf sebegini adalah penghinaan keatas peneroka sendiri. tapi peneroka kata tidak mengapa. durian runtuh ada. tahun ini dengar nya lagi banyak. sebagai umpan pilihanraya. orang felda jual anak dan bini pun tidak mengapa. tujuan isa hendak jadi pengerusi kpf ialah untuk menguasai duit yang ada berbilion ringgit dalam akaun kpf. bila proksi nya dilantik, ada terma dalam perlantikan itu yang menyebut bahawa pegerusi kpf ada hak untuk membuat keputusan mengenai pelaburan atau perbelanjaan sebagai kata pemutus.peneroka tidak nampak bahawa isa samad letak proxy dalam kpf. dia ada hak membuat keputusan akhir. kpf baru sahaja mendapat rm2.2 bilion sebagai imbuhan menyerahkan 51% share nya dalam felda holdings. tapi isa mahu meletakkan tangan kotornya keatas wang tesebut.jadi apa yang diperlakukan keatas rm2.2 billion tersebut? ada sebuah ladang sawit di sarawak yang sudah berada agak lama dalam pasaran; harga nya antara rm750-800 juta. tapi pengerusi kpf memutuskan untuk membeli ladang tersebut sebanyak rm1.2 bllion- kira2 rm400 juta tambahan.

{zalman a} institutional failure and lack of accountability are not limited to 1mdb. year after year, the auditor general has revealed staggering cases of mismanaged public funds. government bodies bought wall clocks at rm 3,810 a piece (the market price is easily below rm 100) and scanners for rm 14,670 (market price: rm 200). the “normalization of corruption” is deeply embedded in the existing hierarchy, from the top to the bottom. in the newly released report, the auditors found that the federal land development authority (felda) lost hundreds of millions due to multiple transactions without proper authorization, dubious planning and execution, and complete mismanagement. it made news for two to three days before disappearing, like pretty much every other scandal. corrupt acts are committed and revealed, followed by public outrage. but with no institution to exercise accountability, the news eventually disappears. it has become a normal cycle.the by-elections last year might provide some hint as to how the general elections will turn out. najib’s coalition won both of them. i was in the suburban areas when opposition parties held a town hall panel session, inevitably speaking in english, touching on issues such as the removal of the attorney general. while these are big, national issues, it felt out of place. there is a visible gap between the politicians, the city folks, the demonstrators who so urgently and desperately want reforms, and the voters outside the cities, who voted for candidates affiliated to najib’s party.to speak plainly, people don’t mind the status quo as long as they are not affected at the most immediate and personal level. the whole 1mdb scandal has been too complicated to be explained to non-english literate voters with no understanding of the complex technical terms, in a five-minute rally,. financial scandals grow more complicated and people just lose interest. maybe they underestimate the cost of it all, maybe they don’t care enough or just don’t lose enough; either way they are not angry enough to want to change the status quo.http://thediplomat.com/

{hihwag} time magazine.....todayshe gave her speech from her dining room, which also functions as her newsroom. it is here that she runs sarawak report, a nearly seven-year-old investigative news website. sixteen months earlier, in july 2015, she had published a bombshell of a report: the personal bank accounts of malaysian prime minister najib razak, she alleged, held nearly $700 million tied to state fund 1malaysia development berhad (1mdb).“i want to say first how sorry i am not to be able to join you in singapore as planned,” rewcastle brown, 57, told the crowd nearly 13,000 km away. her audience, comprising mostly executives and auditors, was rapt. “the loss is entirely mine as it was a huge opportunity for me to meet with so many people of expertise in financial fraud — where i have been stumbling along as a jobbing journalist.”“so, where do i fit as a mere reporter into this juggernaut of a story?” she asked the crowd. “you can hardly expect me not to take advantage of this platform you have kindly provided me with, to put in a plea for the vital role of journalism and free media in exposing corruption that threatens to undermine all our democratic systems.”rewcastle brown’s british penchant for understatement is deceptive. the 1mdb controversy uncovered by this “mere reporter” is the biggest corruption scandal in recent memory to involve a head of government, in terms of both the sum of money involved and the magnitude of the sensational news story it has become. rewcastle brown is, as abraham lincoln apocryphally said of the antislavery author harriet beecher stowe, “the little lady who wrote the book that started this great war.”

{keluarga felda dari seberang.} salam datuk akj:sewaktu tertubuhnya bw plantation tbk/bwp di di kuasai oleh tjipto widodo pada tahun 1998(jika tak silap saya,ladang masih kecil kira 700hecter(zaman itu financial crisis)tjipto widodo besarkan perusahan tersebut pada tahun 2002 bersama halim ashari(warga negara malaysia yg ada pengalaman di bousted),halim dilantik sbg president director dan widodo adalah presiden komisaris.hasilnya memberangsangkan.pada tahun 2009 peter sondakh melirik bw plantation(barangkali md nya org malaysia dan juga ada saham besar di bw).peter sondakh/ps melihat ini peluang terbaik kerna ps terkenal sbg seorg beli jual perusahaan.ps tersenarai org ke 8 terkaya di indonesia setelah sepak terajangnya dalam penjualan pt excel indo kpd telekom malaysia dan mula bangunkan empirenya dimalaysia hasil keakraban beliau dgn najib(agaknya najib yg jadikan ps tersenarai ke8 terkaya di indonesia).halim ashari melepaskan saham beliau di bw plantation pada tahun 2014-2015.dari situ ps tidak perlu memikirkan jaya atau tidak bw plantation kedepan(ada 2 syarikat yg bawa bw plantation ke mahkamah kerna hutang tertunggak tapi telah di selesai di luar pengadilan/mahkamah).bagi ps beli bw dalam tempoh 5 bln 15 hari dan tawarkan pada fgv,kemudian felda dan terakhir pic/ anak perusahaan felda.ps sondakh buat 'instant cash'saperti juga  moto 'cash is king'.modus buat intant cash diulang tayang oleh ps sama saperti penjualan pt excel pada telekom.ps jadi lagi kaya sekarang hasil 2nd offer pada malaysia kerna hanya dengan panggilan telepon transaksi berjaya kedua berjaya,tiada yg boleh halang,kerana moto cash is king dan kuasa di tangan gue(aku).ps bertambah kaya,sahabt di malaysia bertambah uang,yg jual saham pada ps dah duduk goyang kaki di bumi garuda.salam semua

{hihwag} najib has continued to use his billions to pay local supporters, as leaked evidence from his bank accounts shows.numerous cheques have been drawn from his slush funds to individuals from his party – the office holders whose votes support his continuing position in power.  in return, these individuals have chosen to believe najib’s excuses for his money, including his explanation that it came from a small time royal from saudi arabia, (one abdulaziz al saud, who has connections with petrosaudi).  najib says it was abdulaziz who passed him the $681 million dollars as a “donation”, plus the many other earlier payments into his account – including a further $170 million paid in november 2011 from src. he also claims that he returned most of the money via tanore, although the doj say the money was traced to laundering in the states.malaysia’s ruling elite is therefore entering 2017 entrenched in this corrupt collaboration with a leader, who has stolen the money they are enjoying from the public purse.as the economy groans and foreign investor confidence evaporates, this group are clearly further planning to squeeze one last dollop from malaysia’s public funds. yet another $680 million is the payment being offered by felda to buy out eagle plantations from najib’s close friend the indonesian businessman peter sondakh in a blatant further deal to pad out umno’s pre-election purse at the expense of malaysia’s poorest farmers.the logic is that if najib can manage to again buy the next election he will at last be able to put behind him the scandal that after two years has refused to go away, ignore the foreign critics and be safe from justice at last.will he succeed?the answer will come in 2017…. probably.

{taosuo} on the sidelines, there appeared to be some low level "friendly fire" between kak wan and dr mahathir on whether brim handouts is bribery or not.in islam, the key word is intention or 'niat'. if the money from the government's coffers is intended to buy support from the dreadfully poor, and the recipient feels obligated and do vote the bn as per the dogma "you help me and i help you"...then it is certainly bribery.on the other hand, if the recipient takes the money, sniffed a stench of possible buying of votes, and to affirm and register his/her repugnance and contempt for such endeavours, goes and votes for the opposition, then he is certainly not party.the bn expectedly is of course pleading good intentions but from my observations, this time around, not many are buying it.

{taosuo} on the sidelines, there appeared to be some low level "friendly fire" between kak wan(pkr) and dr mahathir on whether brim handouts is bribery or not.in islam, the key word is intention or 'niat'. if the money from the government's coffers is intended to buy support from the dreadfully and desperately poor, and the not so poor, and the recipient feels obligated or beholden and do vote the bn as per the dogma "you help me and i help you"...then it is certainly bribery.on the other hand, if the recipient takes the money, sniffed a stench of possible vote buying and to affirm and register his/her repugnance and contempt for such endeavours, goes and votes for the opposition, then he/she is certainly not party.the bn expectedly is of course protesting good intentions but from my observations, this time around, not many are buying it. yet, targeted groups like felda settlers, some urban poor, the 'civil' service, village apparat including mosque officials, including from sabah and sarawak  etc may be coming in for further special 'considerations'... for which some of the anti corruption people is expected to not give a damn.

{hihwag} there is really no evidence that the opposition can overthrow this kleptocratic regime or if the variables mentioned in the articles would fall into place, thereby facilitating a harapan victory.this is not meant as an attack but rather a rejoinder that we are sailing through very dangerous waters and if we do not get our act together and move beyond simply cheerleading a disorganised opposition, we could end up in a whole world of hurt.1) umno has always suffered electoral setbacks when faced with a cohesive opposition. as it is, the opposition is in disarray. pas is a spoiler made worse by the reality that pkr needs them to remain politically relevant.2) recent by elections have demonstrated that bersatu or at least the personalities behind them and amanah have not gained traction with the demographic that keeps umno in power.3) the issue of corruption plays well with the urban demographic but again for various reasons has not become an issue with rural demographic. if umno delivers everything it says it will deliver, the cycle of complicity will continue. disenfranchised people will continue voting for a regime which puts rice in their bowls. i am not talking about the urban class but rather those people who have depended on real power, federal power exercised corruptly for their benefit. that is the culture some people forget that we are dealing with. we nurtured this culture.4) felda settlers unfortunately are not easily moved by corruption scandals only because they have weathered such scandals over the long umno watch. if the najib regime can find a way to assuage their grievances, then they will remain firmly in the umno camp. and since umno has always found a way to placate this demographic and keep a tight lid on anyone attempting to proselytise to them, i do not think that banking on them would be beneficial to harapan.5) the younger generation of malay voters are a promising demographic but they are currently embroiled in a culture war that consumes most of their energy and effort.young malay oppositional types not only have to contend with the umno regime but they also have to contend with the islamic forces in this country with no help whatsoever from mainstream malay political parties or non-malay political parties who do not view them as part of a new deal but merely a specific racial demographic needed to win the throne of putrajaya.6) race and religion. while my views on these issues are spread across various articles, i think there are deeper issues here than just umno spreading racial and religious discord. i think that umno is the main purveyor or racial and religious disharmony but i do think that what the opposition keeps running into a deep-rooted cultural and historical issues from within pakatan that they have not dealt with hence are not able to come up with a convincing strategy to win over the majority malay demographic.7) finally, the native voters of sabah and sarawak. i would not put much faith in them. they really do have problems that most peninsular malaysians have no idea of.

{zalman a} kuala lumpur (dec 23): datuk seri nazir razak, chairman of cimb group holdings bhd and younger brother of prime minister datuk seri najib razak, today questioned federal land development authority's (felda) acquisition of a 37% stake in indonesia's pt eagle high plantations tbk for us$505.4 million (rm2.26 billion).nazir posted a black-and-white photograph on his instagram this evening of his father — the late prime minister tun abdul razak hussein –  addressing a group of people, presumably early felda settlers.the photograph was uploaded on instagram together with the message: "felda announced buying 37% of eagle high for us$505m or 580 rupiah per share. eagle high's average price in november was 212 rupiah per share, so a 173% premium for a non-control stake. i hope the board will fully justify the acquisition & valuation even though the deal is no longer made by listed fgv (felda global ventures bhd)."garnering 173 “likes” at the time of writing, one of nazir’s followers wrote, "pity to the settlers. felda no longer looking after the poor but only serve the elites."datuk,we are going to see the complete breakdown of governance if mo1 is around for much longer.if you steal once, you will steal again.he is becoming reckless and shameless.i hear a mega-dose of dedak is being prepared by the gomen for the oghang felda, so that they do not do anything rational next year, such as vote against the bugis thief.we must learn as a nation that accepting short term rewards but prolonging corruption is not worth it.if the robber takes rm10,000 from your house and then places rm500 of it on your doorstep, there is no reason to be thankful.but that is how we think.that is why br1m (bribe rakyat 1mappadulung) still "works".

{mat cendana} if people say that "too many" projects in malaysia are by the chinese, then how many would be "just right"? among the realities that we are living with in the world right now is that china has the resources, as well as it being a major buyer of resources that it requires. we as the small fry must accept the realities and adapt accordingly to ensure that we too will benefit from situations. or we can choose to be hostile and make things difficult for china's investors. there will be less of their companies coming in as a result. but will that be beneficial to us all?the fact that these china companies are willing to risk their capital, time and energy in malaysia says something about their confidence in the country and its potentials. sure, it may be better if the investments are more balanced. i'm very sure najib would also be welcoming of companies from the us, europe, japan and middle east coming in with big projects. in fact, i believe he will also welcome the taliban should it want to come in with capital to develop some new port and township in malaysia.right now it's the chinese who are willing to invest in a big way. would be great if us and european companies were to come in too and counter-balance the chinese. but they have their own problems, priorities and plans. they might do so in future but for now it's better that we try to make the best of what is on the table.rather than scaremongering about china buying over malaysia, the more productive thing to do is to monitor these companies. among other things, to ensure that the benefits reach as many malaysians as possible. and not just the few with access to the government and investors.

http://www.malaysiakini.com/news/367873MalaysiaKiniTunjuk bukti saya rasis, Kit Siang cabar Umno2 Jan 2017Ketua Ahli-ahli Parlimen DAP, Lim Kit Siang mencabar Umno dan ejen mereka untuk meneliti ucapan dan kenyataan yang dibuat dalam tempoh 51 tahun yang lalu dan kemukakan bukti beliau 'anti-Melayu, anti-Islam dan anti-raja Melayu'.Berucap di Raub malam tadi, Lim berkata, semua kenyataan dan ucapan beliau menjadi tatapan awam dan tidak pernah disembunyikan."Saya tidak fikir ada lagi pemimpin politik di Malaysia yang telah dituduh selama separuh abad yang lalu, dihina dan difitnah sebagai anti-raja Melayu, anti-Melayu dan anti-Islam."Saya menulis dan bercakap hampir setiap hari selama 51 tahun yang lalu dalam perjuangan politik untuk perpaduan, demokratik dan keadilan Malaysia, dan setiap perkataan dituturkan secara terbuka," kata Lim.Sehubungan dengan itu, Lim yang menganggarkan beliau pernah menutur atau menulis kira-kira 10 juta perkataan dalam kerjaya politiknya dan tiada seorang pun di kalangan pengkritik dapat menemui bukti beliau sebagai 'anti-Melayu, anti-Islam dan anti-raja Melayu"."Cabaran saya kepada para pemimpin Umno, ejen propaganda dan panglima perang siber untuk kemukakan bukti daripada lebih 10 juta perkataan yang saya telah tuturkan atau ditulis dalam 51 tahun yang lalu untuk buktikan saya anti-Melayu, anti-Islam dan anti-raja Melayu."Mereka dialu-alukan untuk teliti apa yang saya katakan atau tulis dalam 51 tahun yang lalu termasuk merekod kenyataan, buku, kaset dan video dengan Cawangan Khas untuk membuktikannya," ujar beliau.Lim menambah, sejak beberapa tahun kebelakangan ini, dakwaan paling biasa yang dilemparkan kepadanya adalah beliau menjadi punca rusuhan 13 Mei di Kuala Lumpur dan seorang 'komunis'.

Mengapa pertikai cuti PM Najib? - Syed AliKUALA LUMPUR: Perdana Menteri, Datuk Seri Najib Tun Razak berhak bercuti atas kedudukannya sebagai ketua negara yang sememangnya memerlukan masa rehat secukupnya, kata Ketua UMNO Bahagian Cheras, Datuk Seri Syed Ali Alhabshee."Jadi, kenapa ada orang sakit hati apabila mendapat tahu Najib pergi bercuti bersama keluarga, sedangkan percutian adalah perkara lumrah."Perdana Menteri juga seperti pemimpin lain atau kakitangan kerajaan yang mempunyai waktu untuk bercuti termasuk bersama keluarga."Kenapa tidak ada pula orang bertanya dan ambil tahu betapa Datuk Seri Najib telah bekerja tanpa mengira waktu dan masa untuk membangunkan negara dan rakyat? soalnya dalam catatan terbaharu di laman blog umnobahagiancheras.blogspot.my miliknya.Tegasnya, tiada pihak yang bertanya atau melahirkan rasa simpati terhadap Datuk Seri Najib yang siang malam bekerja memikirkan bagaimana untuk memakmurkan rakyat termasuk masa depan orang Melayu."Jadi apabila ada perkhabaran mengatakan Najib telah pergi bercuti bersama keluarga bukan sesuatu isu yang perlu dipertikaikan."Lagipun, seandainya Perdana Menteri bercuti, pentadbiran negara tidak akan terjejas kerana beliau masih mempunyai Timbalan Perdana Menteri dan barisan jemaah menteri."Perdana Menteri juga ada masa untuk berehat, tetapi sejak saya kenali beliau sekain lama, Najib jarang memgambil cuti, sebaliknya lebih 24 jam bertungkus lumus bekerja sama ada untuk negara dan parti (UMNO)," tegasnya.Syed Ali turut kesal kerana berita percutian Datuk Seri Najib bersama keluarga di Australia telah diputarbelitkan menjadi isu politik termasuk penggunaan jet kerajaan."Tidak salah bagi mana-mana Perdana Menteri atau ketua kerajaan menggunakan pesawat khas untuk bercuti."Ianya bukan satu larangan bagi Perdana Menteri menggunakan kemudahan tersebut."Isu Perdana Menteri bercuti telah diviralkan menerusi media sosial yang cuba memberi gambaran buruk seolah-olah menjadi satu kesalahan besar kepada Najib untuk pergi bercuti," jelasnya.Justeru, beliau yang juga Setiausaha Badan Perhubungan UMNO Wilayah Persekutuan menyifatkan usaha pihak tertentu memanipulasikan isu tersebut sebagai golongan yang sudah bankrap politik.Dalam masa yang sama, Syed Ali menyifatkan sebagai tidak wajar apabila ada sesetengah pihak sengaja 'membongkar' kegiatan perniagaan membabitkan anak bekas Perdana Menteri, Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad."Walaupun berbeza fahaman politik, tidak bermakna sengaja berbuat demikian untuk mencari kesilapan bagi dijadikan modal politik."Pada hemat saya, jika perniagaan itu bergerak atas landasan undang-undang termasuk syarikat terbabit membayar cukai, ianya tidak boleh dipertikaikan," katanya.Sebaliknya jelas beliau, jika syarikat anak Dr Mahathir lari daripada membayar cukai, maka adalah wajar pihak berkuasa mengambil tindakan.Ditanya sejauh mana kekuatan pakatan pembangkang dengan sokongan Dr Mahathir untuk menumbangkan UMNO pada Pilihan Raya Umum (PRU) akan datang, Syed Ali berkata UMNO sudah biasa dengan situasi sedemikian."Dulu masa Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim pun kita sudah hadapi, tidak ada masalah. UMNO telah bersedia untuk berdepan dengan sebarang kemungkinan," tegasnya. sos

http://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/...-afraid-of-dap/Zaid: Malays no longer afraid of DAPFMT ReportersJanuary 5, 2017Former minister says it is Umno who is afraid of facing opposition knowing its tactic of instilling fear that DAP is anti-Malay is not working.Zaid-IbrahimPETALING JAYA: The Malays are not afraid nor uncomfortable with DAP, Zaid Ibrahim said today in a blog post, pointing to the number of seats the party won in the last general election (GE13).The former Umno minister said that DAP could not have won as many seats without the Malays having voted for them in GE13, adding that this is why Umno is starting to get worried, as their tactic of instilling fear that DAP is anti-Malay is not working.“Malays voted for DAP candidates in many semi-urban seats that the party won during the last election. The DAP, and other opposition parties too, would not have won so many seats in this category if Malays were really opposed to the DAP.“My view is that Malays are neither hostile towards nor afraid of the DAP. They just don’t know enough about the party besides what Tunku Abdul Aziz Ibrahim and Umno have told them,” Zaid said, referring to the former Transparency International-Malaysia director, who was with DAP from 2008 to 2012.The lawyer-turned-politician was optimistic about the outcome of the next general election too, with respect to the suppport from the Malays for the opposition, and specifically DAP.“Malays are generally shy and not expressive in their outlook. They will not raise their fists to Umno to show their displeasure but they will vote Umno out.“Similarly, after many years of brainwashing by Umno, they might not attend a DAP ceramah or join the party as members in droves, but they might give the DAP quiet support at the ballot box,” Zaid said.Zaid, who had joined PKR briefly, explained how he had participated in a recent talk hosted by DAP lawmaker, Raub MP Mohamad Ariff Sabri Abdul Aziz, pertaining to the relationship between Malays and the DAP.“This is a topic that must be discussed openly because Prime Minister Najib Razak and the Umno apparatus have labelled the DAP as anti-Malay and anti-Islam,” he said referring to Najib’s speech at the Umno general assembly last month where he said the next general election would be a fight between Umno and DAP, portraying the opposition party as a threat to Bumiputeras and Islam.“I told the gathering that Malays were generally afraid of hantu (ghosts) but there was no real scientific basis for the fear, other than what has been told to them by their elders.“Similarly, they will warm up to the DAP in no time at all if things are explained to them properly. After all, they have seen the contribution of the party in fighting for justice for all Malaysians.”Training his guns at other opposition parties, Zaid said it was time for them to also embrace DAP as partners in facing BN in GE14.“If the opposition really wants to win GE14, they must have faith that working closely with the DAP will maximise the chance of forming a new government.“If some of them are still uncomfortable with the DAP, then it’s about time they woke up because the people, including Malays, are no longer uncomfortable or afraid of the DAP,” he said.Zaid added that all the people want now is to see a structured and organised opposition.

http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017...-for-pas-rally/PETALING JAYA: PAS will not be able to use Dataran Merdeka for its mammoth rally in support of amendments to the Syariah Courts (Criminal Jurisdiction) Act 1965, said Kuala Lumpur City Hall (DBKL).Mayor Datuk Seri Mohd Amin Nordin Abd Aziz said the historic square would remain off limits to rally organisers as has been the case in the past.“Policy is the same. No Dataran (Merdeka),” he said in a text message.PAS deputy president Datuk Tuan Ibrahim Tuan Man announced on Saturday that a mega rally targeting 300,000 participants would be held on Feb 18 to encourage support for the Syariah Court amendments, better known as RUU355.Tuan Ibrahim said the party had applied for a permit to hold the purple-themed rally, dubbed Himpunan 355, at Dataran Merdeka, but had an alternative location in mind if it was denied.In an immediate response, Mohd Amin said that the Islamist party and its supporters had the green light to gather in Stadium Titiwangsa instead.He also said "no" to the possibility of rally-goers gathering in Padang Merbok.“The (previous) Rohingya rally in Stadium Titiwangsa has proven to be good. So that’s the place,” he said in reference to the Dec 4 rally held in solidarity with Myanmar’s Rohingya Muslims.PAS is planning the large-scale rally to gather support for the Private Member’s Bill brought by its president Datuk Seri Abdul Hadi Awang, which seeks to mete out harsher punishments for Syariah offences.Hadi, who is Marang MP, read out an amended version of his Bill in Parliament back in November, but has deferred its tabling and debate to the next sitting expected in March this year.

They apparently blame the ruling party for the high cost of living.Scores of residents of a village in Penang have left Umno for Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (PPBM), blaming the ruling party for the rising cost of living. This is according to one who claimed to be their spokesman.Ahmad Shamsuddin, who also claimed to have been an Umno member for nearly 50 years, said the villagers of Kampung Tok Sani had become disillusioned with the party,“Times are getting tough for village folk like us,” he said. “Living costs are up. The ringgit is down. We feel we have nobody to turn to, like nobody cares.“As we watched events unfold in Umno, we got together and talked. We decided there was no harm in giving PPBM a try.”Ahmad represented his neighbours in handing over 111 completed membership forms to PPBM supreme council member Marzuki Yahaya at the village in Butterworth yesterday. These were in addition to about 80 forms submitted earlier by individual village residents.Ahmad said the decision was not influenced by anyone from PPBM. The party had not sent representatives to the village to recruit members, he said.“We just believe that PPBM is the party we can turn to. Of course, there is the Tun Mahathir factor too,” he said, referring to PPBM chairman Mahathir Mohamad.“We also considered what had happened internally in Umno. Some leaders had stood up to question the leadership over claims of wrongdoing. They fought and they left Umno.”Asked what he thought of PPBM’s internal problems, Ahmad said these were “small matters”.The four-month-old PPBM has recently been hit by scandal and internal politicking.Party president Muhyiddin Yassin was alleged to have had an affair with a married woman and one of its founding members, Anina Saadudin, was implicated in a “sexting” affair, which she said cost her the post of women’s chief of the party.The outspoken Anina has been upset by the loss, but she remains a supreme council member. She said she would have been retained as women’s chief if Mahathir had been the party president.Yesterday, Muhyiddin denied that there was internal conflict in PPBM and said Anina was removed from her post because her performance was not up to par.Both Muhyiddin and Mahathir denied that the party was split into two factions, one supporting the former and the other the latter.Marzuki, formerly an Umno division chief in Penang, said the Anina issue was only a misunderstanding and one which the top leadership had cleared up.He said people joining the new party were not deterred by the issue or the allegations hurled at the party.“We can say 100% of the people from this village who want to join us are from Umno,” he said. “They are disappointed with the Umno leadership.”He said PPBM had distributed 10,000 membership forms in Penang and about 7,000 had been filled out and returned to the party.“We are going to vet the applications,” he said. “We want to make sure that those we accept into the party will not cause internal problems.”He said PPBM’s Penang chapter would be launched on Jan 14 and the formation of party divisions would follow.“The Bagan division is the first to be endorsed. The remaining 13 will come next. We have also identified the division leaders.”He also said the party had identified the seats it would contest in the next general election.http://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/...ive-ppbm-a-try/

Kulai MP Teo Nie Ching says Muhyiddin cannot speak on behalf of Pakatan Harapan on this matter as UEC has always been on the opposition coalition's manifesto.DAP’s Teo Nie Ching today pointed out that Pakatan Harapan’s manifesto clearly states the opposition coalition will recognise the Unified Examination Certificate (UEC), when dismissing Muhyiddin Yassin’s claim that PH would not do so.“Perhaps Tan Sri Muhyiddin can take a look,” she wrote on her Facebook wall.When contacted, the Kulai MP also said the former education minister could not speak on behalf of PH on this matter as “recognising UEC has always been our common agenda”.“It is in Buku Jingga and the People’s Manifesto, which were produced in 2013,” she told FMT when contacted.This came in response to an earlier report by Sin Chew Daily, quoting Muhyiddin as saying that PH may not recognise the UEC qualification if it seizes federal power in the upcoming polls.The Kulai MP also expressed shock when she first saw Muhyiddin’s remarks, labelling them as awkward.“First of all, I don’t think DAP was consulted over this issue. We welcome all forces to join our fight against Umno and (Prime Minister) Najib Razak.“But for Muhyiddin to say that Pakatan may not recognise UEC … I don’t think he is in a position to say that.”The UEC is a standardised examination conducted by the United Chinese School Committees’ Association of Malaysia (Dong Zhong) in 60 Chinese independent secondary schools in the country.Muhyiddin, who’s also Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (PPBM) president, said earlier today that in order to recognise the UEC, it must first include the History subject, because its current syllabus and exams do not reflect national values.Responding to that remark, MCA Youth secretary-general Leong Kim Soon said Muhyiddin cannot challenge the loyalty and patriotism of UEC students.“UEC students study Bahasa Malaysia, sing the Negaraku during the school assembly and also sit for the SPM exam.“Now that Muhyiddin has openly declared and warned that PH may not recognise the UEC, it is time for DAP to come clean and admit the opposition rejects the UEC.”http://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/...ects-muhyiddin/ Muhyiddin: Pakatan Harapan May Not Recognise, Unified Examination Certificate (UEC)https://forum.lowyat.net/index.php?showtopic=4171254&hl=UEC

Guan Eng (tengah) ketika meninjau projek kerja-kerja tebatan banjir dan menaiktaraf sustem saliran bagi mengatasi masalah banjir di Lorong Perak semalam.Bayangan Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad untuk mengekalkan Pemberian Bantuan Rakyat 1 Malaysia (BR1M) dan menghapuskan GST sekiranya gabungan pembangkang memenangi PRU14 akan datang disokong DAP.Setiausaha Agungnya, Lim Guan Eng berkata, perkara itu juga merupakan pendirian DAP dan menganggap GST sebagai punca kemusnahan ekonomi negara selama ini.Menurutnya, kerajaan tidak perlu melaksanakan GST untuk memberikan BR1M kepada rakyat sebaliknya hanya perlu menjadi sebuah kerajaan yang bersih dan tidak mengamalkan rasuah."Dakwaan BN yang mengatakan GST perlu supaya mereka mampu membayar BR1M adalah tidak masuk akal dan tak logik kerana di Pulau Pinang walaupun kita tidak mengenakan GST namun kerajaan negeri mampu untuk membayar wang penghargaan kepada anak emas, warga emas dan anak sekolah."Disebabkan skandal rasuah yang menyebabkan kerajaan pusat terdesak sehingga terpaksa susahkan rakyat dengan GST," katanya ketika ditemui media selepas menghadiri majlis penyempurnaan projek kerja-kerja tebatan banjir dan menaiktaraf sustem saliran bagi mengatasi masalah banjir di Lorong Perak di sini hari ini.Sementara itu, Guan Eng berkata, BR1M boleh diteruskan untuk disalurkan kepada golongan yang benar-benar memerlukan.Bagaimanapun kaedah perlaksanaannya perlu dikaji semula agar tiada pihak yang boleh mengambil kesempatan termasuk pemberian kepada mereka yang tidak layak dan berkemampuan."Pulau Pinang telah buktikan tanpa GST kita mampu memberikan bantuan kepada rakyat."Berilah peluang kepada kami (Pakatan Harapan) untuk buktikan bahawa apa yang kami laksanakan di Pulau Pinang mampu dilakukan di seluruh negara," katanya.http://www.sinarharian.com.my/politik/dap-...an-gst-1.612514

MCA Negeri Sembilan menggesa DAP supaya berhenti daripada membuat komen berbaur fitnah mengenai pelaburan asing yang dibawa masuk oleh kerajaan Barisan Nasional (BN).Pengerusinya, Datuk Seri Dr Lim Chin Fui, berkata sebagai negara yang bersikap terbuka mengenai perdagangan asing, adalah penting bagi negara seperti Malaysia mengamalkan dasar terbuka mengenai perdagangan."Melalui perdagangan terbuka, ekonomi Malaysia akan berkembang dan maju dengan pesat. Sejak dulu hingga kini, Malaysia mengalu-alukan semua bentuk pelaburan, tidak kira sama ada dari China, Jepun atau Amerika Syarikat."Sebagai sebuah negara berorientasikan eksport, Malaysia amat bergantung pada perdagangan antarabangsa. Sejak sekian lama, dasar perdagangan Malaysia bertujuan mewujudkan persekitaran perdagangan global yang lebih bersifat terbuka dan saksama," katanya dalam kenyataan di sini hari ini.Lim, yang juga timbalan pengerusi Biro PKS (Perusahaan Kecil dan Sederhana) MCA, berkata kerajaan akan terus giat berusaha untuk memajukan ekonomi Malaysia selagi kemajuan dan dasarnya memberi manfaat kepada negara."Sebagai sebuah parti politik dan anggota kerajaan persekutuan yang memerintah, MCA berperanan sebagai penghubung antara negara, membantu rakyat menyertai 'The Belt and Road Initiative' dan membantu perusahaan domestik untuk menjalankan perniagaan di luar pesisir," katanya.MCA Belt and Road Centre (Mbrace), yang dilancarkan Disember tahun lepas, bertujuan membolehkan usahawan Malaysia dan China merebut peluang melalui pertukaran maklumat dan pemadanan perniagaan.Presiden MCA Datuk Seri Liow Tiong Lai dilaporkan berkata pusat itu akan menjadi platform bagi membantu sektor swasta, terutama PKS, untuk menyertai dan meraih manfaat daripada The Belt and Road Initiative, yang dicadangkan Kerajaan China. - Bernamahttp://www.sinarharian.com.my/politik/dap-...fitnah-1.614824

Pas tidak menolak kemungkinan bertanding di kawasan DAP dalam Pilihan Raya Umum Ke-14 (PRU 14) nanti, kata Setiausaha Agungnya, Datuk Takiyuddin Hassan.Bagaimanapun, beliau memberitahu, pihak tertinggi parti masih belum membuat keputusan terhadap perkara tersebut biar­pun ada beberapa kajian bebas termasuk dari dalam Pas sendiri yang mahu parti itu bertanding di kawasan bekas sekutu mereka itu.Dalam masa sama, beliau yang juga Ahli Parlimen Kota Bharu me­negaskan, sehingga kini, Pas kekal dengan keputu­san­nya untuk bertanding di 73 kerusi seperti yang dilakukan dalam PRU-13 biarpun ada pihak seperti PAN dan PPBM mahu seperti pengagihan kawasan dilakukan semula oleh parti-parti pembangkang.“Saya akui Pas ada terima hasil kajian dari beberapa pihak yang mengatakan apa salahnya jika sesetengah tempat yang agak strategik dan biasa ditandingi DAP kita bertanding. Ini kerana biasanya DAP akan bertembung dengan parti bukan Melayu ter­utama MCA dan Gerakan.“Bagaimanapun, saya tidak boleh memberikan ulasan lanjut berhubung kajian berkenaan. Saya juga tidak diberikan maklumat yang jelas berhubung kawasan itu, apa yang boleh dimaklumkan ialah kawasan tersebut adalah di Semenanjung.“Kita perlu ingat ada kerusi DAP dalam PRU-13 lalu merupakan kawasan majoriti orang Melayu dan saya tidak perlu sebut berapa banyak kawasan itu. Buat masa ini, kita perlukan kajian menyeluruh,” katanya.Beliau berkata demikian selepas menyampaikan sumbangan dana penyelamat bola sepak negeri ini daripada Badan Bertindak Bola Sepak Kelantan (BBBSK) bersama kepada pasukan Piala Presiden Kelantan 2016 di sini malam tadi.Sumbangan sebanyak RM13,000 itu disampaikan Pengerusi Jawatankuasa Kerajaan Tempatan, Perumahan, Belia dan Sukan negeri, Datuk Abdul Fattah Mahmood di atas kejayaan pasukan tersebut mempertahankan kejuaraan mereka pada tahun lalu.https://www.utusan.com.my/berita/politik/pa...an-dap-1.434159

http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017...-mca-president/The StarSunday, 22 January 2017DAP did nothing for rakyat despite having 38 seats, says MCA presidentby sarban singhSEREMBAN: The rakyat, particularly the Chinese, gained nothing by giving 38 seats in Parliament to the DAP at the last general election, says MCA president Datuk Seri Liow Tiong Lai (pic).Despite the support given, the DAP had nothing to show how the party had helped the people and the nation prosper.“The DAP has only been good at making unsubstantiated allegations and criticising Barisan Nasional and the MCA,” Liow told reporters after opening the Temiang MCA service centre.“And, with the general election due anytime, they have now entered into panic mode and are making even more baseless and ridiculous claims,” he said.The DAP won 38 of the 222 Parliamentary seats in 2013. It lost the Teluk Intan seat at a by-election in 2014.Citing an example, Liow said the Opposition, particularly the DAP, was carrying tales that Malaysians would be adversely affected by the huge investments coming in from China.“They are instilling fear that locals may lose out to the Chinese investors and that the MCA has become rudderless and was a Chinese agent.“This is despite knowing that the Malaysian government always puts the interest of locals first, such as when sourcing for materials although the project may be carried out by a foreigner,” Liow said, adding that it was possible to get China to make huge investments here as both countries enjoyed good ties.Johor DAP chief and Kluang MP Liew Chin Tong recently mocked MCA’s role in bringing in investments from China and had asked if MCA was China’s agent as it had set up a PRC Affairs Committee and MCA Belt and Road Centre.Liow said apart from making unsubstantiated claims, the DAP also practised “divisive and negative” politics. “These included making claims that Malaysia is a failed state.”Liow said the MCA always fought for the Chinese community, making sure Malaysia remained moderate and peaceful.At the opening, Liow said all MCA divisions had been directed to activate their operation centres.“Wherever possible, we will try and open more than one centre to better serve the people,” he said.

Errrm.....http://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/...-minister-post/MCA admits it asked for deputy prime minister postFaiz Zainudin | January 21, 2017On that, Mahathir was right, but he was bringing it up for the wrong reasons, says key MCA leader.Ti-Lian-Ker_mca_600_2PETALING JAYA: MCA admits it has asked the prime minister for an additional deputy prime minister’s post to be created and filled by an MCA president.But MCA central committee member Ti Lian Ker said that in doing this, it was only relaying the wishes of its members.Speaking to FMT, he said the suggestion was made to enhance the government’s efforts to look after the interests of the non-Malays and non-Muslims of the country.“Actually, MCA was only relaying the wishes of the Chinese for a deputy prime minister’s post as an effort to resolve the problems faced by the non-Malays and non-Muslims,” Ti said.He said former prime minister Dr Mahathir Mohamad had made it seem that MCA was only seeking to provoke the Malays and that MCA had done wrong and that DAP was more sensitive towards Malay sentiments.“This is Mahathir’s politics for you. He tries to gain support from opposition parties by playing up racial sentiments.”Ti was responding to Mahathir’s statement, in which the Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia chairman said it was MCA, and not DAP, which asked for a deputy prime minister’s post.Previously, Mahathir had said that DAP had asked for a deputy prime minister’s post, only to correct himself after his initial statement was refuted by DAP secretary-general Lim Guan Eng.In 2009, MCA deputy secretary-general Loke Yuen Yow had asked Prime Minister Najib Razak to create an additional deputy chief minister’s post and an additional Barisan Nasional deputy chairman’s post to reflect “true power sharing”.At that time Loke said the creation of the additional deputy prime minister’s post would also show that the government acknowledged the role and contribution of the Chinese community to nation building.The deputy prime minister’s post has been filled by an Umno leader since the first cabinet of Malaya was set up in 1955.In the 2008 general election, BN’s poor performance saw the coalition lose a lot of ground to the opposition and also lose four states: Selangor, Penang, Kedah and Perak.MCA and other non-Malay component parties lost nearly half of their parliamentary and state seats.The opposition continued to win greater support from the Chinese in the 2013 general election and MCA had to settle for only seven parliamentary seats.

Barisan Nasional (BN), yang sekian lama merancang dan melaksanakan agenda pembangunan negara demi kesejahteraan rakyat dan kemakmuran negara, merupakan pilihan terbaik untuk dipilih rakyat pada Pilihan Raya Umum Ke-14 (PRU14).Menteri Komunikasi dan Multimedia, Datuk Seri Dr Salleh Said Keruak berkata,  rakyat perlu menimbangkan tentang tiga perkara dalam membuat pilihan mereka  pada PRU14 nanti.Perkara pertama adalah BN di bawah kepimpinan Perdana Menteri Datuk Seri Najib Tun Razak mengamalkan konsep muafakat dan bekerjasama sebagai satu pasukan sedangkan pembangkang masing-masing dengan pandangan dan pendirian sendiri, katanya di sini, hari ini.Perkara kedua pula BN merancang membangunkan Malaysia dan perancangan mengenainya diumumkan kepada masyarakat berbanding pihak pembangkang yang tiada perancangan dan hanya berpolitik semata-mata.Perkara ketiga, katanya, BN melaksanakan apa yang telah dirancangkan sebaliknya pihak pembangkang, khususnya di negeri-negeri yang diperintah, hanya merancang tetapi tidak mampu untuk melaksanakannya."BN adalah satu gabungan yang mempunyai perancangan dan melaksanakan perancangan tersebut. Ertinya, masa depan Malaysia lebih terjamin di bawah pimpinan BN.     "Kita tidak boleh menyerahkan Malaysia kepada satu pasukan yang tidak ada muafakat antara mereka sendiri," katanya.Salleh berkata, walaupun parti-parti komponen BN ada kalanya berbeza pandangan namun, ia adalah perkara biasa khususnya dalam sistem demokrasi.BN juga mempunyai wadah tertentu untuk mengurus perbezaan tersebut sebaliknya pembangkang bercakaran sesama sendiri secara terbuka, katanya.Menurutnya pihak pembangkang masih tidak sehaluan dalam isu-isu utama termasuk berhubung pengagihan kerusi dan penggunaan satu simbol menjelang PRU14."Permasalahan di antara pihak pembangkang itu berikutan perbezaan ideologi politik dan kepentingan politik. Saya yakin jika ini berterusan, kita akan lihat pakatan pembangkang berpecah kerana tidak sehaluan," katanya.Sebaliknya, Salleh berkata, BN mengamalkan konsep muafakat dan sentiasa bekerja sebagai satu pasukan selain memainkan peranan masing-masing demi kesejahteraan rakyat."Kita bertanding bukan sekadar kemenangan parti-parti individu sahaja tetapi kemenangan BN secara keseluruhannya kerana kita ingin menjadi gabungan politik yang meneruskan agenda pembangunan dengan menjamin kestabilan negara dan kesejahteraan rakyat selain menentukan peluang ekonomi dan pekerjaan dapat disediakan," jelasnya. Sebagai contoh, katanya, Transformasi Nasional 50 (TN50) yang dilancarkan Najib baru-baru ini menunjukkan kerajaan pimpinan BN mendapatkan input dan maklum balas daripada anak muda mengenai aspirasi mereka dan membina masa depan dalam masa 30 tahun lagi.Mengenai Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad, Salleh berkata bekas perdana menteri itu   sering membuat pusingan U dan pendirian politiknya juga sudah berubah."Beliau berbuat demikian kerana kepentingan politik semata-mata dan bukannya kerana kepetingan negara atau Malaysia. Beliau akan menggunakan apa juga kaedah agar BN dan Umno dikalahkan dalam pilihan raya umum akan datang," katanya. - Bernamahttp://www.sinarharian.com.my/politik/bn-p...keruak-1.616131

PETALING JAYA: Umno Kedah menolak spekulasi PKR yang Barisan Nasional (BN) akan hilang banyak kerusi dalam pertandingan 3 penjuru di negeri itu.Exco Kedah yang juga Ketua Umno Bahagian Merbok, Datuk Tajul Urus Mat Zain sebaliknya yakin parti itu dapat mempertahankan semua kerusi Dewan Undangan Negeri (DUN) yang disandang ketika ini.“Malah, majoriti kami akan bertambah. Tak perlu ragu-ragu, BN akan menang lagi di Kedah,” katanya kepada FMT.Beliau mengulas dakwaan Pengerusi PKR Kedah, Dr Azman Ismail kononnya Pakatan Harapan (PH) mempunyai kelebihan dalam pertandingan 3 penjuru di Kedah, manakala “PAS dan Umno akan menderita”.Tajul mentertawakan kenyataan Azman dengan berkata, PH dan Parti Pribumi Bersatu Malaysia (PPBM) yang akan menderita daripada hakikat mereka perlu membuat pakatan pilihan raya.Beliau berkata, kerjasama antara pakatan pembangkang dan parti yang baru ditubuhkan itu adalah “palsu” dan pengundi dapat melihatnya.“Dahulu, DAP benar-benar menentang Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad,” katanya merujuk pengerusi PPBM.“Dr Mahathir sendiri melabelkan DAP parti perkauman. Tetapi, hari ini mereka bekerjasama.“Apabila rakyat Kedah melihat kerjasama ini, mereka tahu ini adalah pemimpin tiada prinsip dan mereka bekerjasama hanya untuk kepentingan politik sendiri.“Apa yang rakyat Kedah mahu ialah pemimpin yang bekerja keras untuk negeri, bukan diri sendiri.”Umno kini memegang 18 kerusi DUN dan MCA 2. PAS pula mempunyai 8 kerusi, PKR 4, DAP 2, manakala PPBM dan Amanah masing-masing 1.Penganalisis politik berkata, lebih separuh daripada 36 kerusi DUN dan 15 kerusi Parlimen mungkin menyaksikan pertandingan 3 penjuru pada pilihan raya umum akan datang.http://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/...esar-kata-umno/

Allahyarham Tun Razak (kanan) yang bersalaman dengan Mao Zedong di Beijing, tahun 1974 menjadi titik bermulanya persahabatan antara Malaysia dengan China.ISU kemasukan pelabur China ke negara kita telah mencetuskan bualan hangat. Bukan sahaja rakyat biasa, ahli-ahli politik malahan kerabat raja turut terbabit sehingga menimbulkan pertikaman lidah. Dijangkakan isu ini akan terus dibangkit sehingga PRU akan datang.Ketika ekonomi Malaysia dalam keadaan merudum sejak kebelakangan ini, dengan kejatuhan harga petroleum dan nilai ringgit; ditambahkan lagi kenaikan harga barangan, menyebabkan rakyat jelata semakin tertekan dan kerap menyalahkan kerajaan.Perdana Menteri, Datuk Seri Najib Tun Razak bagaimana pun tidak mendiamkan diri. Lalu, untuk mencari jalan keluar, beliau terbang ke China untuk memujuk pelabur-pelabur dari negara komunis itu untuk menanam modal di negara kita.Hasilnya, perjanjian perdagangan antara kedua-dua negara telah tercapai dengan pelaburan bernilai RM144 bilion berjaya dibawa pulang oleh Najib awal November lalu.Malaysia bukan sahaja mengeratkan hubungan dengan China, tetapi apa yang lebih penting ialah peluang perniagaan bakal diberikan kepada rakyat tempatan sekali gus merancakkan pertumbuhan ekonomi negara kita.Kekuatan ekonomi China sememangnya tidak boleh disangkal oleh mana-mana negara. Tidak ada ruginya bagi sesebuah negara yang menjalankan perniagaan dengan China termasuklah Malaysia.Bagi yang masih mengingati, hubungan diplomatik antara Malaysia dengan China dimeterai setelah lawatan Perdana Menteri, Tun Abdul Razak Hussein ke China pada tahun 1974. Gambar allahyarham, juga ayah kepada Najib, yang bersalaman dengan Presiden China, mendiang Mao Zedong menjadi detik yang bersejarah dan sukar dilupakan.Kunjungan perdana menteri kedua Malaysia itu bukan sahaja merapatkan hubungan antara Malaysia dengan China, bahkan telah membolehkan BN mencapai kemenangan besar pada PRU yang diadakan pada tahun yang sama.Faktor berkawan dengan China telah menyebabkan ramai pengundi Cina memberikan sokongan padu kepada BN pada PRU 1974. Walaupun baru berusia setahun ketika itu bagi menggantikan Parti Perikatan, tetapi BN mampu mencipta kemenangan cemerlang apabila berjaya meraih 72 daripada 82 kerusi parlimen yang dipertandingkan.Kini sejarah silam bagaikan berulang. Apakah Najib akan menggunakan 'taktik' sama seperti yang dilakukan ayahnya bagi membolehkan BN mencapai kemenangan besar pada PRU akan datang?Apabila Najib 'berkawan' dengan China, lebih-lebih lagi membawa masuk perniagaan dari China, apakah pengundi Cina akan kembali memberi sokongan kepada BN?Dua PRU yang terakhir, iaitu 2008 dan 2013 menyaksikan BN tidak terdaya menghalang 'Tsunami Cina' apabila majoriti pengundi Cina memberi sokongan padu kepada pembangkang.MCA menjadi mangsa untuk pengundi Cina melepaskan geram. PRU 2008, MCA memenangi 15 parlimen dan 32 Dun. Lima tahun kemudian, parti itu mengalami kekalahan paling teruk dalam sejarah penubuhannya apabila hanya dapat tujuh kerusi parlimen dan 11 Dun.Namun, Najib kini seperti mempunyai 'senjata' baharu, iaitu 'isu pelabur China ke Malaysia' yang boleh diguna untuk menumbangkan calon-calon pembangkang, khususnya dari DAP.Najib yang dilihat mampu menawan hati pengundi Cina kini menjadi kebimbangan kepada pakatan pembangkang.Sekiranya 30 peratus pengundi Cina yang menyokong Pakatan Rakyat pada PRU lalu beralih menyokong BN pada PRU14, dijangkakan banyak kerusi milik DAP dan PKR akan dirampas oleh BN.Najib yang ketika ini masih menghadapi pelbagai dakwaan daripada pembangkang mengenai isu dana RM2.6 bilion dan 1Malaysia Development Berhad (1MDB) mungkin tidak perlu risau lagi kerana dengan berniaga dengan China, segalanya akan terselamat.Sebaliknya, keadaan inilah yang membimbangkan Pakatan Harapan. DAP, PKR, Amanah hatta Bersatu semakin tidak selesa. Ketika Bersatu masih belum mengukuhkan pengaruhnya, bantuan daripada rakan-rakan partinya amat diperlukan.Sekiranya DAP mengalami kekalahan besar kepada MCA dan Gerakan atas 'isu China' ini, sudah tentu akan menjejaskan peluang Pakatan Harapan mengambil alih tampuk pemerintahan daripada BN.Maka tidak hairanlah pemimpin-pemimpin Bersatu melalui pengerusinya, Tun Dr Mahathir Mohamad dan Presidennya, Tan Sri Muhyiddin Yassin kerap kali menuduh Najib sanggup menggadai negara semata-mata untuk membawa masuk pelabur-pelabur China ke negara kita.Pembangkang pada mulanya menjangkakan mampu menggugat kedudukan BN dengan isu dana RM2.6 bilion dan 1MDB. Tetapi kini apabila tauke-tauke besar dari China  membawa puluhan juta ringgit menjalankan pelbagai projek besar di negara kita, isu-isu yang membelenggu Najib ini kini menjadi senyap seketika.PRU akan datang menjanjikan sesuatu yang menarik. Isu peribadi Najib mahupun isterinya, Datin Seri Rosmah Mansor mungkin akan terus digembar-gemburkan oleh lawan, tetapi 'isu China' ini jauh lebih berkesan untuk memujuk pengundi agar menyokong BN.Sedang kedudukan ekonomi negara berada dalam keadaan tidak menentu, rakyat tentunya lebih utamakan sumber rezeki. Inilah apa yang diinginkan dengan kemasukan pelabur-pelabur China ini.Rakyat mahu cari makan, bukan mahu main politik ataupun bersifat perkauman seperti orang politik!http://www.sinarharian.com.my/nasional/naj...yahnya-1.617210

KAMI ucap terima kasih atas keprihatinan YB Datuk dalam isu tugu banjir ini. Ia membuktikan bahawa Kerajaan Kelantan telah bertindak bijak dalam hal ini. Namun kami kesal dengan maklumat pra matang dan seakan-akan tidak membuat "kerja rumah" dahulu sebelum meneruskan edisi-edisi serangan kepada kerajaan negeri yang disalurkan kepada Datuk hingga akhirnya ia akan memalukan bukan sahaja Datuk, akan tetapi seluruh anggota parti PAN Kelantan. Tugu banjir bukan isu pokok. Yayasan Amanah Tok Kenali (YTK) lah hero sebenar dalam hal tanah ini. Datuk cuba untuk menggambarkan kononnya tanah yang sempit sekangkang kera itu, yang didirikan tugu banjir oleh NGO, sebagai satu tanah yang bernilai RM300,000.00. Sedangkan keluasan sebenar tanah tersebut adalah 1.1 ekar dan ia adalah tapak bagi Masjid al-Jauhar yang telah berada lebih puluhan tahun di sana! Dan nilai tanah seluas itu, yang juga mempunyai deretan kedai makan berhadapan dengan Masjid Jauhar, dan adanya ruang rehat kepada para musafir yang mahu berhenti rehat untuk makan, mandi dan melepaskan lelah, di bahagian sisi masjid, termasuklah bahagian atas masjid, yang mempunyai dewan untuk kegunaan masyarakat setempat, adalah jauh lebih murah daripada harga yang Datuk dakwa semalam.Bayangkan tuan tuan, masjid yang digunakan sekian lama oleh sebahagian penduduk Guchil, menjadi persinggahan puluhan ribu anak perantau setiap tahun, menjadi pusat sehenti program masyarakat setempat, adalah sebenarnya milik individu seorang Cina. Maka dengan segala kebijaksanaan kerajaan negeri, tanah seluas 1.1 ekar ini, yang berada di segitiga emas Kuala Krai, yang jika dinilai secara profesional, ia mungkin akan mencecah harga pasaran sehingga RM1 juta, telah berjaya diselamatkan atas nama Yayasan Amanah Tok Kenali (YTK) dengan harga lebih murah daripada harga pasaran.Nah Datuk, tidakkah sekarang ia menjawab kekeliruan Datuk yang mengatakan bahawa Almarhum Tok Guru menubuhkan YATOK ini dahulu untuk membangunkan pendidikan dan pembangunan insan? Adakah menyelamatkan tanah Masjid Jauhar seluas 1.1 ekar bukan satu kerja mulia yang sudah berjaya dimainkan oleh YTK? Dan adakah NGO membina sebuah tugu bagi memperingati Bah Kuning 2014, Bah Merah 1927, Bah Besar 1967 dan lain-lain sejarah, dengan menggunakan wang mereka sendiri, di bucu hujung lidah tanah 1.1 ekar ini menjadi satu dosa? – HARAKAHDAILY 26/1/2017Penulis ialah Ketua Penerangan Dewan Pemuda PAS Negeri Kelantanhttp://www.harakahdaily.net.my/index.php/b...pas-jawab-husam

AHMAD AMZAD HASHIM | 26 Januari 2017.AKTA 355 bukanlah suatu akta yang baru. Nama lainnya ialah Akta Mahkamah Syariah (Bidang Kuasa Jenayah) 1965 , pindaan 1984. Kerana itulah kita ada Mahkamah Syariah di setiap negeri dan seluruh negara pada hari ini.Akta 355 ini sudah diadakan sejak tahun 1965 lagi. Ketika itu Mahkamah Syariah telah diberi kuasa menghukum 6 bulan penjara, RM1,000 denda atau kedua-dua sekali.Tiada siapa pernah mempertikaikan Akta 355 sebagai melanggar perlembagaan Malaysia ketika itu walau negara sudah lama ada parti politik bukan Islam seperti DAP, MCA, Gerakan atau MIC.Pada tahun 1984, Akta 355 dipinda memberi kuasa 3 tahun penjara, RM5,000 denda dan sebatan 6 kali. Pindaan ini dilakukan di Parlimen. Dibahaskan dan diluluskan di Parlimen. Seperti hari ini juga.Sekali lagi DAP dan parti bukan Islam yang lain tiada pula mempertikaikan pindaan ini, jauh sekali menyebut pindaan 'melanggar' Perlembagaan Malaysia.Pada tahun 1989, Akta 355 dipinda lagi. Kali ini supaya diperluaskan ke Sabah dan Sarawak.Pindaan 1989 ini pun tiada pernah ada yang bangkitkan soal melanggar perlembagaan Malaysia.Rakyat Malaysia yang bukan Islam menghormati Mahkamah Syariah sebagai urusan agama Islam yang tidak pantas dicampuri bukan Islam.Anehnya apabila Akta 355 mahu dipinda pada tahun ini setelah pindaan kuasa hukuman kali terakhir dibuat pada tahun 1984, 32 tahun yang lalu, berbangkit bermacam-macam dakwaan kononnya melanggar perlembagaan persekutuan. Padahal ia cuma soal menambah kuasa hukuman sahaja. Sama sahaja seperti berlaku pindaan tahun 1984.Umat Islam mempunyai sebab yang kuat untuk memperkasakan peranan Mahkamah Syariah. Ini kerana usaha pendidikan yang ada perlu seiring dengan undang-undang yang tegas bagi menjaga kesejahteraan semua. Tempoh 1965 hingga 1984, masalah dan cabaran sosial dalam negara tidak sehebat hari ini.Hari ini Malaysia dicatat di peringkat dunia ditangga ke-8 industri pelacuran, ditangga ke10 kadar penggunaan arak/alkohol, pusat perjudian tersohor, gejala amalan rasuah, korupsi. Masalah dalam masyarakat berkait runtuhnya rumahtangga oleh kadar perceraian yang membimbangkan, kadar kelahiran bayi luar nikah yang sangat tinggi, kadar kes buang bayi dan lain lain lagi. Kes penagihan dadah, bohsia, rempit sebahagian besarnya berakar umbi kerana ketiadaan jiwa yang sejahtera oleh runtuhnya sistem hidup berkeluarga yang sempurna. Statistik yang ada menunjukkan umat Islam menyumbang peratus tertinggi dalam kebanyakan gejala negatif yang kronik ini.Umat Islam yang menjadi 65 peratus dari rakyat Malaysia perlu kembali kepada undang-undang yang ditentukan oleh ajaran Islam sebagai ubat terbaik memulihkan mutu individu orang-orang Islam.Kelihatan yang langgar perlembagaan bukan usul pindaan RUU355. Tetapi perbuatan menghalang umat Islam mematuhi syariat Islam itu sendirilah perbuatan melanggar perlembagaan. Ini kerana jika agama lain diberi kebebasan untuk diamalkan, mengapa menghalang diamalkan Islam oleh penganut Islam walhal Islam sudahpun menjadi agama bagi persekutuan.Beraninya segelintir bukan Islam mempertikai dan campur tangan urusan agama Islam adalah kerana adanya kalangan orang Islam sendiri yang mempertikaikan.Ia tidak akan berlaku begitu jika umat Islam bersatu. Tidak akan berlaku begitu jika tiada orang Islam yang jadi tali barut mereka yang anti Islam. Tidak jadi begitu jika orang Islam tidak terlalu obses sangat dengan sokongan politik bukan Islam kerana cita-cita politik peribadinya.Lihat kandungan Perlembagaan Malaysia perkara 3."Perkara 3. Agama bagi Persekutuan(1) Islam ialah agama bagi Persekutuan; tetapi agama-agama lain boleh diamalkan dengan aman dan damai di mana-mana Bahagian Persekutuan.(2) Di dalam tiap-tiap Negeri selain Negeri-Negeri yang tidak mempunyai Raja, kedudukan Raja sebagai Ketua agama Islam di Negerinya mengikut cara dan setakat yang diakui dan ditetapkan oleh Perlembagaan Negeri itu, dan, tertakluk kepada Perlembagaan itu, segala hak, keistimewaan, prerogatif dan kuasa yang dinikmati olehnya sebagai Ketua agama Islam, tidaklah tersentuh dan tercacat; tetapi dalam apa-apa perbuatan, amalan atau upacara yang berkenaan dengannya Majlis Raja-Raja telah bersetuju bahawa perbuatan, amalan atau upacara itu patut diperluas ke seluruh Persekutuan, setiap Raja lain hendaklah atas sifatnya sebagai Ketua agama Islam membenarkan Yang di-Pertuan Agong mewakilinya.(3) Perlembagaan-Perlembagaan Negeri Melaka, Pulau Pinang, Sabah dan Sarawak hendaklah masing-masing membuat peruntukan bagi memberi Yang di-Pertuan Agong kedudukan sebagai Ketua agama Islam di Negeri itu.(4) Tiada apa-apa jua dalam ini mengurangkan mana-mana peruntukan lain dalam Perlembagaan ini.(5) Walau apa pun apa-apa jua dalam Perlembagaan ini, Yang di-Pertuan Agong hendaklah menjadi Ketua Agama Islam di Wilayah-Wilayah Persekutuan Kuala Lumpur, Labuan dan Putrajaya; dan bagi maksud ini Parlimen boleh melalui undang-undang membuat peruntukan-peruntukan bagi mengawal selia hal ehwal agama Islam dan bagi menubuhkan suatu Majlis untuk menasihati Yang di-Pertuan Agong mengenai perkara-perkara yang berhubungan dengan agama Islam"Pada saya, lebih 'jantan' DAP membawa sahaja ke Mahkamah Tinggi bagi memperoleh jawapan sama ada dakwaan mereka bahawa RUU355 melanggar perlembagaan itu benar atau tidak.Kerana keputusan da kes iaitu saman parti Gerakan terhadap EKJSII kelantan dan saman empat individu Islam terhadap RUU355 ternyata tidak mendokong dakwaan DAP. Malah kes EJKS telah dibawa dari Mahkamah Tinggi ke Mahkamah Rayuan dan sehingga mahkamah yang paling tinggi sekali Mahkamah Persekutuan. Keputusannya adalah sama.Kepada seluruh umat Islam, jangan uzurkan diri daripada menghadiri Perhimpunan Perpaduan Umat Islam Menyokong Memperkasakan Mahkamah Syariah H355 pada 18 Februari 2017 di Kuala Lumpur.Jika umat Islam Indonesia boleh berkumpul hingga 7 juta orang bagi memberi mesej solidariti ummah, kita patut malu jika kita gagal menyatukan suara juga sebegitu. – HARAKAHDAILY 26/1/2017http://www.harakahdaily.net.my/index.php/b...gaan-dakyah-dap

Sos songlapKUALA LUMPUR – Bekas Ketua Pegawai Eksekutif TH Heavy Engineering Bhd. (THHE) didakwa di Mahkamah Sesyen di sini hari ini atas lima tuduhan melakukan pecah amanah melibatkan lebih RM2.5 juta. Datuk Nor Badli Munawir Mohamad Alias Latfi, 52, bagaimanapun mengaku tidak bersalah dan memohon dibicarakan sebaik pertuduhan terhadapnya dibacakan oleh jurubahasa di hadapan Hakim Madihah Harullah.Dia dituduh melakukan kesalahan komersial itu di pejabat THHE Fabricators Sdn. Bhd., Tingkat 23, Tower B, Menara UOA, Bangsar, Nombor 5, Jalan Bangsar Utama 1, di sini, antara Jun hingga Oktober 2013.THHE merupakan sebuah anak syarikat di bawah Tabung Haji yang terbabit dalam industri minyak dan gas sejak 2002 serta disenaraikan di papan utama Bursa Malaysia pada 2005 lalu dengan modal dibenarkan RM800 juta.Pendakwaan kes dibuat mengikut Seksyen 409 Kanun Keseksaan, yang jika disabitkan kesalahan tertuduh boleh dikenakan hukuman penjara maksimum sehingga 20 tahun, sejumlah sebatan dan bayaran denda.Hakim turut membenarkan tertuduh diikat jamin sebanyak RM400,000 dengan hanya seorang penjamin berserta syarat tambahan iaitu pasport milik Nor Badli Munawir perlu diserahkan kepada pihak mahkamah.Mahkamah itu kemudian menetapkan 15 Mac ini untuk tarikh sebutan semula kes tersebut. Tertuduh ditahan pihak Suruhanjaya Pencegahan Rasuah Malaysia pada November tahun lalu. – Agensi/Mynewshub.cc/HAA
